title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Desert Regional Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: To the point questions. They hold a lot of hiring events but for their med surg units. Very easy to get a job within those units. ER and L&D are hard.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to be a nurse?

title: Phlebotomy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Desert Regional Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: It was over the phone. I got laid off from one of their locations so I was transferred to Desert Regional. So I was guaranteed the job. I just had to have a short conversation with management before starting this position.
Interview Questions: How fast I could draw patients

title: HIM Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Desert Regional Medical Center (Palm Springs, CA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Quick. Dress business casual. Bring copies of your resume and recommendation letters. Be early and smile through your mask. The interview was with a supervisor and another clerk. Ask questions about the position and what they will first expect of you your first weeks.
Interview Questions:
Skills that can be used for the position
What I know of the field I applied in
Why I was interested

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Desert Regional Medical Center in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with recruiter twice, then scheduled panel interview in person. In person interview was very relaxed and felt natural. It was aimed more at a personality fit for the unit rather than behavioral questions.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Desert Regional Medical Center (Palm Springs, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Lasted  approximately 20-30 minutes. I was interviewed by a 2-person panel.  They were both nice,  friendly,  and down to earth.  They made me feel comfortable during my interview.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had a problem with another nurse that you were working with,  and if so,  how did you handle it?

title: Wound Care RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Desert Regional Medical Center (Palm Springs, CA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Shadowed and did on job training. Was able to meet other staff, get orientated to charting and where supplies were kept, and get a feel for the work flow.  Was able to see pros and cons.

title: Labor and Delivery RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Desert Regional Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: It took a while to get an interview, when I went to the interview it went very well.  I had a reference, so it went easier than expected. I did not end up getting the job offer due to other circumstances.
Interview Questions: what makes a good l&d nurse?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Desert Regional Medical Center (Palm Springs, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: You go in meet with the hiring manager. They get to know you a little assessment your skills and layout the duties and functions. Ask for current license and current cpr. Really a enjoyable process.
Interview Questions: Describe what your scope of practice is/ was in the past jobs.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Desert Regional Medical Center (Palm Springs, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: After applying online and waiting a couple of weeks, I received a call from one of the recruiters. She advised me that I had not attached my transcripts. Once I attached the transcripts, I didn't hear from them again until I called them about 4-6 weeks later. After that, I was scheduled an immediate interview with the hiring manager. Things moved very quickly after my call to them. I telephone interviewed with the recruiter, then in person with the hiring manager. Offer was made four days later.
Interview Questions: Having just graduated from nursing school, would you have a problem taking direction from a nurse without a bachelor's degree? Would you feel confident enough to handle a procedure the way you were taught in school?

title: RN, Bsn Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Desert Regional Medical Center (Palm Springs, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the Director and Assistant Director during a job fair. I was also interviewed by members of the outpatient wound clinic given that wound care was my second choice at that time. However, because I didn't have an acute care experience at that time, it was smarter to get a solid Medical-Surgical experience before moving to a different specialty. So I ended up being interviewed by the Director and Assistant Director of the unit where I am working now.
Interview Questions: Given that I was doing home health nursing prior to transitioning to acute care, they were interested to ask how I was going to adjust to the pace and also adjust to working interdependently with other health providers.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Desert Regional Medical Center (Palm Springs, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Recruitment was hard to negotiate through.  Skype interview first.  In person with the team.  Then interviewed with some cross functional leaders (round table) at numerous times throughout 1 single day.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience supervising difficult employees

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Desert Regional Medical Center (Palm Springs, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
There was initially a phone interview with the C-level that I would report to eventually, then multiple panel interviews conducted with various directors and future staff, CEO interview, COO interview, CNO interview.
A tour of my future department was offered as well.
Afterwards, my recruiter took care of the salary negotiations and got me exactly what I asked for

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Desert Regional Medical Center (Palm Springs, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: two weeks after first call then group then one to one then hr handeled paperwork then a start date with orientaion,3 months probation then you are hired permenantly,then elegible for benefits and other perks.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Desert Regional Medical Center (Palm Springs, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: thru travel  co      fill out application, send in required papers, wait for acceptance, job site, hours, pay, uniforms, call times, frequency, staffing, sick call, call backs, back up staffing, ceu credits available  phone, fill in paper work, type and color of uniforms,   are scrubs supplied, if not what color are they, do I purchase them or are they supplied.   separate lockers provided to staff with locking capability. break room with essential equipment to use when on call,   ie  refrigerator, microwave, sink, , cafeteria 24/7, security 24/7
Interview Questions: would I be able to work wkend call
